image.caption: A general view of Westpac Stadium
image.longCaption: A general view of Westpac Stadium during the third Twenty20 International match between New Zealand and England at Westpac Stadium on February 15, 2013 in Wellington, New Zealand

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara not out 113 (105b 14x4 0x6 159m) SR: 107.61
Tillakaratne Dilshan c Ronchi b Southee 81 (98b 5x4 1x6 137m) SR: 82.65

dismissalComment.html: and Dilshan's innings comes to an unlikely end as he offers up an edge outside off to Ronchi, who completes the take gleefully to make Sri Lanka two down. Good innings from the right-handed opener as he looked set for what would have been his third century of the series
133 kph, Lahiru is struck on front by this inswinging delivery from Anderson, and looks dead plumb. Doesn't even bother to review it as Dilshan agrees rather grimly..

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, and Chandimal's stay comes to a premature end as he chases after this short of a length delivery outside his off stump. Little aimless from the right-hander as he simply looked to stand his ground and bludgeon across the line. Offers an outside edge to Ronchi, who has been peerless today

139 kph, the Perera experiment comes unstuck as Anderson entices to have another go outside his off, as Perera miscues a slice, this time getting the ball high over third man, with the fielder doing well to dive forward to take the catch

and Dilshan's innings comes to an unlikely end as he offers up an edge outside off to Ronchi, who completes the take gleefully to make Sri Lanka two down. Good innings from the right-handed opener as he looked set for what would have been his third century of the series

135 kph, and Southee is rewarded for persisting in that fourth/fifth stump channel as he gets Mahela to nick at one outside his off, with the right-hander looking for the glide to third man, but ends up edging instead to Ronchi who is able to complete the take to his right with a dive. Was starting to look settled out there was Mahela, but unfortunately he has to depart from the middle

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne lbw b Anderson 30 (41b 4x4 0x6 69m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Lahiru is struck on front by this inswinging delivery from Anderson, and looks dead plumb. Doesn't even bother to review it as Dilshan agrees rather grimly..

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Ronchi b Southee 81 (98b 5x4 1x6 137m) SR: 82.65

dismissalComment.html: and Dilshan's innings comes to an unlikely end as he offers up an edge outside off to Ronchi, who completes the take gleefully to make Sri Lanka two down. Good innings from the right-handed opener as he looked set for what would have been his third century of the series

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Ronchi b Southee 14 (14b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, and Southee is rewarded for persisting in that fourth/fifth stump channel as he gets Mahela to nick at one outside his off, with the right-hander looking for the glide to third man, but ends up edging instead to Ronchi who is able to complete the take to his right with a dive. Was starting to look settled out there was Mahela, but unfortunately he has to depart from the middle

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Seekkuge Prasanna lbw b Mills 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: full delivery which looked to be nipping down leg as Prasanna doesn't get into any sort of position to get this away as he plants his front foot across the line. NZ have requested the review as they are sure they have got his man. Looks like this may have struck in line with leg stump. Prasanna in no position there to play the flick to the leg side. No inside-edge or deviation. Although if was given not out initially, three reds means it will be reversed. Good decision that from NZ as Prasanna is given his marching orders

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Ronchi b Anderson 5 (15b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, and Chandimal's stay comes to a premature end as he chases after this short of a length delivery outside his off stump. Little aimless from the right-hander as he simply looked to stand his ground and bludgeon across the line. Offers an outside edge to Ronchi, who has been peerless today

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mills b Anderson 20 (12b 1x4 1x6 12m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, the Perera experiment comes unstuck as Anderson entices to have another go outside his off, as Perera miscues a slice, this time getting the ball high over third man, with the fielder doing well to dive forward to take the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c Jayawardene b Dilshan 54 (83b 4x4 0x6 120m) SR: 65.06

dismissalComment.html: and NZ suffer a huge blow as Kane, who was looking to get down the track to Dilshan, ends up adjusting his shot to try and sweep it behind, with the ball catching the top-edge before spooning over to Mahela at short backward square, who is able to take the catch with a dive forward. Ends a spirited knock from the young right-hander. This could be the vital breakthrough the visitors were looking for in this match

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi b Kulasekara 47 (42b 4x4 1x6 59m) SR: 111.9

dismissalComment.html: 126 kph, and Kula has the last word as he bowls the perfect yorker right at the base of middle which Ronchi, who was looking to get up and under down the ground, is unable to dig out. Was a beauty of an inswinging yorker as Kula leapt high in the air in celebration, with Ronchi not looking amused at all. Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: 138 kph, NZ's opening conundrum continues as Latham's middle peg is knocked back after playing down the wrong line to this length ball which straightens, before the left-hander inside-edges onto the timber to make NZ 11 for 2

133 kph, Eranga strikes! Anderson has to go! Ends up offering a feather of an edge to Sangakkara as this back of a length nips away at the last moment, catching the edge of Anderson's bat before Sangakkara takes the chance low to his left

119 kph, begins with a dream delivery just outside off which nips in as Guptill plants his foot, with the ball curling into the pad. This looked dead as gone as soon as it struck, and the umpire confirmed the decision soon after. What a start for the tourists as NZ are 0 for 1!

126 kph, and Kula has the last word as he bowls the perfect yorker right at the base of middle which Ronchi, who was looking to get up and under down the ground, is unable to dig out. Was a beauty of an inswinging yorker as Kula leapt high in the air in celebration, with Ronchi not looking amused at all. Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill lbw b Kulasekara 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 119 kph, begins with a dream delivery just outside off which nips in as Guptill plants his foot, with the ball curling into the pad. This looked dead as gone as soon as it struck, and the umpire confirmed the decision soon after. What a start for the tourists as NZ are 0 for 1!

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham b Eranga 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: 138 kph, NZ's opening conundrum continues as Latham's middle peg is knocked back after playing down the wrong line to this length ball which straightens, before the left-hander inside-edges onto the timber to make NZ 11 for 2

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor b Chameera 11 (22b 1x4 0x6 35m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 146 kph, and Chameera has got a dream start to his limited-overs career as he succeeds in getting Taylor to chop one onto the stumps off the bottom edge as he went searching after this slightly fullish length outside off. Taylor has to go after putting up 11. Chameera is over the moon as he celebrates with his team-mates. That was also the fastest ball of the day too!

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Chandimal b Chameera 24 (38b 1x4 0x6 52m) SR: 63.15

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, Chameera picks up another on debut as he gets Elliott to go after this back of a length delivery outside off which is carved high to the fielder at deep cover, who is able to take the catch safely. Elliott's steady knock comes to an end

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c Jayawardene b Dilshan 54 (83b 4x4 0x6 120m) SR: 65.06

dismissalComment.html: and NZ suffer a huge blow as Kane, who was looking to get down the track to Dilshan, ends up adjusting his shot to try and sweep it behind, with the ball catching the top-edge before spooning over to Mahela at short backward square, who is able to take the catch with a dive forward. Ends a spirited knock from the young right-hander. This could be the vital breakthrough the visitors were looking for in this match

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Sangakkara b Eranga 29 (20b 2x4 2x6 28m) SR: 145

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Eranga strikes! Anderson has to go! Ends up offering a feather of an edge to Sangakkara as this back of a length nips away at the last moment, catching the edge of Anderson's bat before Sangakkara takes the chance low to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi b Kulasekara 47 (42b 4x4 1x6 59m) SR: 111.9

dismissalComment.html: 126 kph, and Kula has the last word as he bowls the perfect yorker right at the base of middle which Ronchi, who was looking to get up and under down the ground, is unable to dig out. Was a beauty of an inswinging yorker as Kula leapt high in the air in celebration, with Ronchi not looking amused at all. Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori b Prasanna 35 (30b 6x4 0x6 51m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: excellent flighted delivery from Prasanna which dupes Vettori as he played down the wrong line, with the ball going through the legs to find the stumps behind. The Sri Lankans have a few parting words for Vettori as he goes, with NZ sliding to 218 for 8 now

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c Sangakkara b Perera 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: 130 kph, and the ninth wicket falls as Southee perishes with a miscued, top-edge which flies high over to Sangakkara as he went for the pull, but the bat rotated in his hands to offer up this straightforward chance. NZ now staring down the barrel as SL look to wrap it up here in Wellington

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Kulasekara/Sangakkara) 30 (17b 2x4 1x6 28m) SR: 176.47

dismissalComment.html: gets down the track before the spin away from him means he is forced to edge it away behind square. The gully sees this quickly as he runs across to pickup and fire in a throw as Sangakkara is able to remove the stump before the batsman made the striker's end

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Kulasekara/Sangakkara) 30 (17b 2x4 1x6 28m) SR: 176.47

commentTextItems.html: gets down the track before the spin away from him means he is forced to edge it away behind square. The gully sees this quickly as he runs across to pickup and fire in a throw as Sangakkara is able to remove the stump before the batsman made the striker's end

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.10pm Brendon McCullum is given the ODI series trophy by the NZC president as the rest of the players filter into position for the paparazzi. Watch out for this team in just a few weeks time as they look good to go quite deep into the tournament once it kicks off on Feb 14. But there is still plenty of cricket left in between, with two more ODIs here in New Zealand to look forward to as the Pakistan tour kicks off on January 31 here in Wellington. Till then though, this is Rohan Sharma signing off for ESPNcricinfo. Ciao!

Lahiru Thirmanne, Sri Lanka captain: Thought Kumar and Dilshan played really well today. They have been brilliant throughout the series. Our main concern was our death bowling and today it came off good. I thought today all the bowlers bowled really well.

Kane Williamson, New Zealand captain: We want to win every game we play, but SL played so well today, on the back of Sanga's hundred and Dilshan's knock. They bowled very well tonight and swung it late, so they made it very difficult for us. It is important for us to be right in at the end with the bat though. Our middle to lower order all had good time in the middle. We kept pushing the game forward, but unfortauntely we were unable to get over the line, but in the field we were very good. There are a lot of things to take from the surface. It does have a bit of dew that comes in later so we will have to consider that going into the World Cup. SL have put us under pressure at times, and am pleased with how the boys have gone too.

Kumar Sangakkara, Man of the Match: It's been a good year. The entire team has been working very hard. The hard work has paid off with some good performances out in the middle. The guys are disappointed for not winning the series, but we are pleased with how we have come out in the end. It is great being part of a team that pushes each player to be slightly better every day, or every tour. I just try to do the basics as well as I can, and if you take some of the performances from right through the series, you can see everyone has chipped in so it has been satisfying. The wickets have been fantastic. The Black Caps have played outstandingly during the Tests and ODIs. There is a lot we can learn from them, but we also are proud of our cricket and how we do in big tournaments. Good to have Lasith back in the fold. We just want to take a week here to get our minds fresh before the World Cup begins.
The Man of the Match is Kumar Sangakkara for his 113.
10.00pm Presentation has just begun. Some words from the NZC dignitaries and sponsors for both teams as they look to the World Cup now.
We will be back shortly for quotes from the match presentation

9.50pm Sri Lanka manage to get away with a consolation victory in this final match of the ODI series as they make the result 4-2 in favour of New Zealand as we come to a close. Sri Lanka manage to hold on to a 34-run victory, which was shaped largely by the discipline showed by the new-ball bowlers, while the middle overs were well controlled by the tourists as well. Chameera was impressive on debut, while Sangakkara proved again what a class act he is with a 21st ODI century to his name.

commentPreTextItems.html: 36 off 30 now. Mills is the man for NZ. Prasanna back on to see what he can do as they look to take pace off the ball here in the dying stages

commentTextItems.html: drifts one in from outside off which is steered away through deep midwicket
122 kph, all welcome boundaries here as McClenaghan gets away a chop-on past the keeper to get four through the fine leg region

commentPostTextItems.html: Nirmal: "whatever the match result may be, Mills playing sensibly"

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: 124 kph, ends up striking this back of a length back at the bowler, who is able to cut it off after misfielding initally

commentPreTextItems.html: 41 off 33 now. A tough ask given the situation..

commentTextItems.html: 125 kph, close to getting it into the blockhole as Mills mistimes this drive down to long on
125 kph, looks like he may have just slammed this straight down long off's throat, but gets this more straighter to find the boundary
123 kph, fuller one which is chipped over long off by Mills as he is able to come back for two once more

commentPreTextItems.html: Kula back on now to try and finish it off

commentTextItems.html: 120 kph, looking to land another yorker but gets it wrong as Mills just bludgeons this full toss over long-off, but not well enough to beat the boundary rider on the rope
worked away off the back foot down to long on to finish the over

commentPostTextItems.html: Sammy H: "Charging down the wicket is surely a no-no for a tail end batsmen when you know if you miss the ball it's game over."

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: guided down to the fielder at long off as they are able to complete a brace
able to successfully dig out this flighted one on middle
able to ease one away through long on as they complete a single

commentPostTextItems.html: SD: "Don't call the match off until Mills is dismissed. Well, I mean, of course, right? But the guy can hit some seriously big ones, and can pull off seemingly improbable chases. Mitch is a worry though. Can he bat?"

commentTextItems.html: gets forward before striking this firmly at mid-off
able to fend away this delivery arriving on leg, as the ball is hit away to the off side
132 kph, gives up a loose delivery which just sits up for Mills outside his off stump as he carves this away ferociously to find the extra-cover rope

commentPostTextItems.html: Sammy H: "Southee has just blown this for New Zealand. Mills had the right idea pushing for 1's and 2's. The run rate wasn't very high. Silly shots from New Zealand have lost us this game. A worry that we don't seem to have the mental strength to win games the hard way."

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentPreTextItems.html: The final batsman for New Zealand is Mitchell McClenaghan

commentTextItems.html: 131 kph, Mills getting in some batting practice before the World Cup as he waits on this short ball about chest height before dispatching it about 30 rows back over fine leg

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c Sangakkara b Perera 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: 130 kph, and the ninth wicket falls as Southee perishes with a miscued, top-edge which flies high over to Sangakkara as he went for the pull, but the bat rotated in his hands to offer up this straightforward chance. NZ now staring down the barrel as SL look to wrap it up here in Wellington
131 kph, goes over the wicket now as this time Mills is able to blast away off the back foot to deep cover

commentPostTextItems.html: Yash: "Did the Sri Lankans really sledge Vettori? Even Mcclenaghan, the most aggressive of the NZ sledgers didn't say anything to any of big 3 (or any sri Lankan for that matter) and here we see them giving words to a member of team (and that's Daniel Vettori too!) who has just won 2-0 and 4-1. Not impressed. "

commentTextItems.html: 133 kph, full and on middle as this is drilled straight to the boundary rider at deep extra-cover

commentPreTextItems.html: Time for Perera to have a bowl. Going round the wicket

commentTextItems.html: 132 kph, full delivery going across Southee as this is driven on the full to long off

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne lbw b Anderson 30 (41b 4x4 0x6 69m) SR: 73.17

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Lahiru is struck on front by this inswinging delivery from Anderson, and looks dead plumb. Doesn't even bother to review it as Dilshan agrees rather grimly..

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c Ronchi b Southee 81 (98b 5x4 1x6 137m) SR: 82.65

dismissalComment.html: and Dilshan's innings comes to an unlikely end as he offers up an edge outside off to Ronchi, who completes the take gleefully to make Sri Lanka two down. Good innings from the right-handed opener as he looked set for what would have been his third century of the series

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Ronchi b Southee 14 (14b 2x4 0x6 20m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: 135 kph, and Southee is rewarded for persisting in that fourth/fifth stump channel as he gets Mahela to nick at one outside his off, with the right-hander looking for the glide to third man, but ends up edging instead to Ronchi who is able to complete the take to his right with a dive. Was starting to look settled out there was Mahela, but unfortunately he has to depart from the middle

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Seekkuge Prasanna lbw b Mills 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: full delivery which looked to be nipping down leg as Prasanna doesn't get into any sort of position to get this away as he plants his front foot across the line. NZ have requested the review as they are sure they have got his man. Looks like this may have struck in line with leg stump. Prasanna in no position there to play the flick to the leg side. No inside-edge or deviation. Although if was given not out initially, three reds means it will be reversed. Good decision that from NZ as Prasanna is given his marching orders

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c Ronchi b Anderson 5 (15b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, and Chandimal's stay comes to a premature end as he chases after this short of a length delivery outside his off stump. Little aimless from the right-hander as he simply looked to stand his ground and bludgeon across the line. Offers an outside edge to Ronchi, who has been peerless today

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c Mills b Anderson 20 (12b 1x4 1x6 12m) SR: 166.66

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, the Perera experiment comes unstuck as Anderson entices to have another go outside his off, as Perera miscues a slice, this time getting the ball high over third man, with the fielder doing well to dive forward to take the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Martin Guptill lbw b Kulasekara 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: 119 kph, begins with a dream delivery just outside off which nips in as Guptill plants his foot, with the ball curling into the pad. This looked dead as gone as soon as it struck, and the umpire confirmed the decision soon after. What a start for the tourists as NZ are 0 for 1!

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tom Latham b Eranga 6 (9b 1x4 0x6 19m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: 138 kph, NZ's opening conundrum continues as Latham's middle peg is knocked back after playing down the wrong line to this length ball which straightens, before the left-hander inside-edges onto the timber to make NZ 11 for 2

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson c Jayawardene b Dilshan 54 (83b 4x4 0x6 120m) SR: 65.06

dismissalComment.html: and NZ suffer a huge blow as Kane, who was looking to get down the track to Dilshan, ends up adjusting his shot to try and sweep it behind, with the ball catching the top-edge before spooning over to Mahela at short backward square, who is able to take the catch with a dive forward. Ends a spirited knock from the young right-hander. This could be the vital breakthrough the visitors were looking for in this match

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor b Chameera 11 (22b 1x4 0x6 35m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: 146 kph, and Chameera has got a dream start to his limited-overs career as he succeeds in getting Taylor to chop one onto the stumps off the bottom edge as he went searching after this slightly fullish length outside off. Taylor has to go after putting up 11. Chameera is over the moon as he celebrates with his team-mates. That was also the fastest ball of the day too!

headshotImage.caption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dushmantha Chameera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Grant Elliott c Chandimal b Chameera 24 (38b 1x4 0x6 52m) SR: 63.15

dismissalComment.html: 139 kph, Chameera picks up another on debut as he gets Elliott to go after this back of a length delivery outside off which is carved high to the fielder at deep cover, who is able to take the catch safely. Elliott's steady knock comes to an end

headshotImage.caption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shaminda Eranga player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Corey Anderson c Sangakkara b Eranga 29 (20b 2x4 2x6 28m) SR: 145

dismissalComment.html: 133 kph, Eranga strikes! Anderson has to go! Ends up offering a feather of an edge to Sangakkara as this back of a length nips away at the last moment, catching the edge of Anderson's bat before Sangakkara takes the chance low to his left

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Ronchi b Kulasekara 47 (42b 4x4 1x6 59m) SR: 111.9

dismissalComment.html: 126 kph, and Kula has the last word as he bowls the perfect yorker right at the base of middle which Ronchi, who was looking to get up and under down the ground, is unable to dig out. Was a beauty of an inswinging yorker as Kula leapt high in the air in celebration, with Ronchi not looking amused at all. Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Daniel Vettori b Prasanna 35 (30b 6x4 0x6 51m) SR: 116.66

dismissalComment.html: excellent flighted delivery from Prasanna which dupes Vettori as he played down the wrong line, with the ball going through the legs to find the stumps behind. The Sri Lankans have a few parting words for Vettori as he goes, with NZ sliding to 218 for 8 now

headshotImage.caption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Seekkuge Prasanna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Kulasekara/Sangakkara) 30 (17b 2x4 1x6 28m) SR: 176.47

dismissalComment.html: gets down the track before the spin away from him means he is forced to edge it away behind square. The gully sees this quickly as he runs across to pickup and fire in a throw as Sangakkara is able to remove the stump before the batsman made the striker's end

dismissalText.commentary: Tim Southee c Sangakkara b Perera 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: 130 kph, and the ninth wicket falls as Southee perishes with a miscued, top-edge which flies high over to Sangakkara as he went for the pull, but the bat rotated in his hands to offer up this straightforward chance. NZ now staring down the barrel as SL look to wrap it up here in Wellington

dismissalText.commentary: Mitchell McClenaghan not out 5 (6b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: 119 kph, begins with a dream delivery just outside off which nips in as Guptill plants his foot, with the ball curling into the pad. This looked dead as gone as soon as it struck, and the umpire confirmed the decision soon after. What a start for the tourists as NZ are 0 for 1!

Big blow to NZ's chances as Ronchi and Vettori threatened to take this game firmly away from he Sri Lankans

notes: Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 42 runs, 0 wicket)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 11.2 overs (68 balls), Extras 3
1st Wicket: 50 runs in 68 balls (HDRL Thirimanne 19, TM Dilshan 28, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 66/0 in 14.0 overs (HDRL Thirimanne 29, TM Dilshan 34)
TM Dilshan: 50 off 62 balls (4 x 4)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 19.5 overs (119 balls), Extras 4
2nd Wicket: 50 runs in 49 balls (TM Dilshan 32, KC Sangakkara 19, Ex 1)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 27.3 overs (165 balls), Extras 6
KC Sangakkara: 50 off 52 balls (7 x 4)
2nd Wicket: 100 runs in 98 balls (TM Dilshan 43, KC Sangakkara 56, Ex 3)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 175/2 in 32.5 overs (KC Sangakkara 58)
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 2 wickets)
Sri Lanka: 200 runs in 36.2 overs (218 balls), Extras 8
Over 38.3: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - S Prasanna (Upheld)
Sri Lanka: 250 runs in 45.2 overs (272 balls), Extras 9
Over 46.4: Review by New Zealand (Bowling), Umpire - CB Gaffaney, Batsman - KMDN Kulasekara (Struck down)
KC Sangakkara: 100 off 100 balls (12 x 4)
Innings Break: Sri Lanka - 287/6 in 50.0 overs (KC Sangakkara 113, KMDN Kulasekara 12)
New Zealand innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 34 runs, 2 wickets)

Drinks: New Zealand - 59/3 in 16.0 overs (KS Williamson 27, GD Elliott 8)
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 61 balls (KS Williamson 26, GD Elliott 21, Ex 3)
New Zealand: 100 runs in 23.6 overs (144 balls), Extras 9
KS Williamson: 50 off 75 balls (4 x 4)
Drinks: New Zealand - 141/6 in 30.3 overs (L Ronchi 8)
New Zealand: 150 runs in 32.5 overs (197 balls), Extras 9
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 52 runs, 1 wicket)
7th Wicket: 50 runs in 46 balls (L Ronchi 27, DL Vettori 23, Ex 2)
New Zealand: 200 runs in 38.6 overs (234 balls), Extras 11
New Zealand: 250 runs in 44.6 overs (270 balls), Extras 11

milestones.description: Sangakkara has become the top scorer for SL in ODIs with 13434 runs, going past Jayasuriya's 13364
Sangakkara has broken the record for most dismissals (474) in ODIs, going past Gilchrist's 472

stories.summary: With the series wrapped up 4-1 before the seventh ODI in Wellington, New Zealand will be looking to rest their key players and test the strength of their wider squad
